head.title: The Bulls, the Bears and Social Security

hedline.hl1: The Bulls, the Bears and Social Security

block.p: Re ''A Retirement Fable,'' by Paul Krugman (column, Oct. 11):
Re ''A Retirement Fable,'' by Paul Krugman (column, Oct. 11):

I wonder what solution proponents of the ''individual account'' system will propose in the event that those Social Security funds earmarked for personal investment in the capital markets disappear through some unexpected financial downturn or poor investment choice.
The system will have to compensate those current recipients of Social Security whose money will have been diverted into the individual investment system.

It will also have to compensate future recipients whose nest eggs may have been damaged but who, nonetheless, will clamor for full payout of the Social Security benefits to which they will still feel entitled when they retire.
There's no right way to partly privatize the Social Security system without considering these issues and the fiscal effect of correcting a problem of this type in the future.
